title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 507.12 - Auction and secondary market monitoring
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 507.12 - Auction and secondary market monitoring

State Regulations
(a) In advising the committee, the
professional independent auction monitor will monitor each CO
2
allowance auction and develop and apply data
collection methods, metrics, and analytic techniques, and thresholds for
identifying any bidding behavior or activity that may have a significant impact
on the efficiency and performance of such auctions, including, but not limited
to: (1)
collusion; (2)
market power; and/or
(3)
price manipulation. (b) The professional independent auction
monitor shall also monitor allowance market data and information known to the
department and the authority including allowance transactions and associated
pricing reported in the CO
2
allowance tracking system, and other relevant data and information to ensure fair competition, efficient
pricing, and protection against collusive or manipulative behavior in the CO
2
allowance auctions and the CO
2

Budget Trading Program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
507.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
